page.title: 01BLUNHAM
page.content: The village stands on mainly light, loamy soil which is ideally suitable for market gardening. This was given a great boost by the opening of the railway in the 1860's which allowed produce from the area to reach market quickly. The railway has now closed and most people travel to work in nearby towns but the proximity of the A1 main road means that the area still enjoys a favourable position for the distribution of market gardening produce. Unlike the position in a number of parishes in the country, there has not been a wholesale move to cereal growing and lettuces, brussel sprouts, etc. are still important crops.
